byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

abstract: Bids for EMI Group, the music company that Citigroup put up for sale in June, have proved lower than expected, The New York Times reported.
snippet: Bids for EMI Group, the music company that Citigroup put up for sale in June, have proved lower than expected, The New York Times reported.
lead_paragraph: Bids for the EMI Group, the music company that Citigroup put up for sale in June, have proved lower than expected, according to The New York Times. Offers for EMI's recorded music unit were as high as $1.3 billion, while its publishing arm fetched bids as high as $2 billion. Offers to buy all of EMI appear to be lower than what Citi would fetch in a breakup. Read more »

headline.main: Bids for EMI Said to Fall Short
